addSong

boolean addSong(java.lang.String name,
                int durationInSeconds,
                java.lang.String artists,
                java.lang.String genre,
                java.lang.String album)
Adds the specified song to the database. Song/Movie names are unique in the database.

Parameters:
name -
durationInSeconds -
artists -
genre -
album -
Returns:
true if the song is added and false otherwise (e.g., the song already exist).

removeMediaFile

boolean removeMediaFile(java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Removes the movie/song from the database.

Parameters:
mediaFileName -
Returns:
true if the media is removed and false otherwise (e.g., it does not exist).

getMediaFileInfo

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMediaFileInfo(java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Returns the information associated with the specified media file (song or movie). For a song the ArrayList will have name, durationInSeconds, artists, genre, playCount, album; for a movie the ArrayList will have name, durationInSeconds, artists, genre, playCount, resolution, and rating.

Parameters:
mediaFileName -
Returns:
ArrayList with information or null (if mediaFileName not found).

increasePlayCount

void increasePlayCount(java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Increases by one the play count associated with the mediaFile. No operation will take place if mediaFileName is not found.

Parameters:
mediaFileName -

getPlayCount

int getPlayCount(java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Returns the play count.

Parameters:
mediaFileName -
Returns:
returns the play count or -1 (if media not found).

createPlayList

boolean createPlayList(java.lang.String playListName)
Creates a playlist.

Returns:
true if the playlist has been created and false otherwise (e.g., the playlist already exists).

removePlayList

boolean removePlayList(java.lang.String playListName)
Removes the playlist.

Parameters:

Returns:

addMediaToPlayList

boolean addMediaToPlayList(java.lang.String playListName,
                           java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Adds the mediaFileName to the playlist. The new entry is added at the end of the current list of entries associated with the playlist.

Parameters:
playListName -
mediaFileName -
Returns:
true if the add operation was completed successfully and false otherwise (e.g., playlist does not exist).

removeMediaFromPlayList

                                java.lang.String mediaFileName)
Removes the specified entry from the playlist.

Parameters:

mediaFileName -
Returns:
true if the remove operation was completed successfully and false otherwise (e.g., playlist does not exist).

getPlayList

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPlayList(java.lang.String playListName)
Returns an ArrayList with the media file names in the playlist.

Parameters:
playListName -
Returns:
ArrayList or null (if no playlist exist).

getAllPlayLists

Returns:
set with names or empty set.

getMediaFileNamesWith

MySortedLinkedList<java.lang.String> getMediaFileNamesWith(int durationInSeconds,
                                                           java.lang.String artists,
                                                           java.lang.String genre,
                                                           java.lang.String album,
                                                           java.lang.String resolution,
                                                           java.lang.String rating)
Returns a sorted linked list with the names of media files satisfying the specified parameters restrictions. If a field has a value of null, then that criteria is ignored in the search. If durationInSeconds is -1, then the duration is ignored. If a durationInSeconds value is provided, then media with a duration less than or equal to that value will be included in the search results.

Parameters:
durationInSeconds -
artists -
genre -
album -
resolution -
rating -
Returns:
sorted linked list sorted by name

getAllMediaFilesNamesByPlayCount

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllMediaFilesNamesByPlayCount()
Returns an ArrayList sorted by the play count (entries with a higher play count will appear first in the list). If two files have the same count, then use the media file name to sort the media files.

Returns:
sorted linked list sorted by play count.

getAllMediaFilesNamesByGenre

java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>> getAllMediaFilesNamesByGenre()
Returns a map mapping genre to the set of media file names associated with that genre.

Returns:
map
